Description: A rectangular glazed composition tile: with a convex face and rounded edges. On the back is a projection to aid the secure fixing of the tile in plaster. This projection is pierced so that the tile could additionally be held by a copper wire, which passed through each tile in turn. The glaze, probably green originally, has completely decayed to a dull white, and one corner of the tile is missing.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl.XI, 234;W. M. F. Petrie, 'Prehistoric Egypt : corpus of prehistoric pottery and palettes' (Warminster, 1974), pl.XLIX, 25; J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' I (London, 1989), pl.XVIII, 2; B. Adams, 'Ancient Hierakonpolis' (Warminster, 1974), 35, no. 165 and pl.25; G. Dreyer, 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 32 (Wiesbaden, 1976), 86, VI (b) and pl.26a-b.
